name: Muir Woods National Monument
description: Walk among old growth coast redwoods, cooling their roots in the fresh water of Redwood Creek and lifting their crowns to reach the sun and fog. Federally protected as a National Monument since 1908, this primeval forest is both refuge and laboratory, revealing our relationship with the living landscape. What will you discover in Muir Woods?
shortDescription: Walk among old growth coast redwoods, cooling their roots in the fresh water of Redwood Creek and lifting their crowns to reach the sun and fog. Federally protected as a National Monument since 1908, ...

operatingHours.description: Muir Woods is open every day of the year, with exceptions for inclement weather and hazardous conditions. Our core winter hours are 8AM-5PM; in the spring, summer, and fall we are open later based on increased daylight hours. Updates on closures will be posted as an alert to the website and on social-media pages.

fees.title: Entrance - Per Person
fees.description: $15 per person 16 years of age and older. Entrance fees may be purchased in advance with your parking/shuttle reservation or upon arrival to the park. Parking/shuttle reservations are required for all vehicles and shuttle riders visiting Muir Woods National Monument. Reservation fees are separate from entrance fees. Please visit GoMuirWoods.com for parking/shuttle reservations.

climate.weatherDescription: The coast redwood forest is cool most times of the year with temperatures ranging from 40 - 70 F/ 4 - 21 C. Always come prepared with layers. From late October to early May, expect cool weather & possible rain. Summer months (June-August) can be warmer, but it is generally cool and dry. Expect heavy fog in the morning, burning off in the afternoon. Often, the fall (September-October) is the warmest time of year.

images.title: Muir Woods National Monument
images.altText: Wooden sign and entrance to Muir Woods National Monument
images.caption: Entrance to Muir Woods National Monument

images.title: Bridge through Muir Woods
images.altText: A wooden bridge crosses Redwood Creek in the redwood forest
images.caption: Summer is a busy time at Muir Woods. Visit early in the morning for the most pleasant experience.

images.title: Bohemian Grove
images.altText: Sun rays shine down on a visitor among very tall redwood trees
images.caption: Later afternoon is a gorgeous time of day to visit Bohemian Grove, inside Muir Woods.

images.title: Banana Slug
images.altText: A yellow banana slug creeping along a twig
images.caption: Banana slugs creep along the forest floor in Muir Woods and are likely to be abundant in the warmer days of winter.

images.title: Informal interpretation at Muir Woods
images.altText: in a shady forest, a ranger in a flat hat and green uniform speaks with a small group of visitors
images.caption: Muir Woods rangers deliver daily tree talks to connect visitors with the redwood forest ecosystem.

images.title: Rangers speaking with school group
images.altText: Two rangers stand next to a big sign and speak to visitors seated in the foreground
images.caption: More than just a forest, Muir Woods has rich cultural history.

images.title: Visitor at MUWO sign
images.altText: a visitor points to a sign that says muir woods
images.caption: Visitors can receive orientation at the front entrance before visiting the forest.

images.title: rangers pointing at redwoods
images.altText: two rangers in flat hats with their backs to the camera point at trees in the distance
images.caption: Rangers are always available at Muir Woods to welcome visitors, answer questions, and provide orientation.
